main event: Two P-FE fighter pilots reported an unidentified object resembling a box kite in appearance and stationary in the Honshu area, Japan on 19 May 1950.
interesting points: The object was first detected by ground radar before the pilots made contact with it.
The object was similar to a box kite in appearance with approximate dimensions of thirty inches by twenty-four inches.
No visible means of supporting the object was noted, and the pilots reported it as remaining stationary.
A dropsonde was released from an FB-29 reconnaissance aircraft, which had a similar appearance to the reported sighting.
The report was forwarded for information as the object could not be positively identified as the dropsonde due to incongruity of the time element.
sighted object: unidentified object resembling a box kite
